{"to":["mark.thompson@journalist.com"],"subject":"Re: Dispute Resolution Process Overview","body":"Dear Mark,

Thank you for your follow-up and for the opportunity to clarify how Union Trust Bank handles customer disputes. Below is a concise, up-to-date overview that addresses your questions and notes a few recent enhancements to our programme.

1. Initiating a dispute
• Customers can raise a complaint through any branch, our 24-hour Contact Centre (1-800-UTB-HELP), the secure Online Banking portal (Complaints ▸ New Dispute) or by post to the Customer Advocacy Department.
• We acknowledge every complaint within five business days, provide a unique case reference and assign a dedicated case manager who serves as the single point of contact.

2. Investigation timelines & key milestones
• Standard cases – investigation and final response within 30 calendar days (target lowered from 35 days last year).
• Complex cases – may extend to 60 days; if so, the customer receives a written interim update at Day 30 explaining the delay and a revised timeline.
• Card-transaction disputes – if an investigation is likely to exceed 10 business days, provisional credit is issued by Day 10 in line with card-scheme rules.
• A formal resolution letter is sent at closure summarising findings, any account adjustments and next-step options.

3. Documentation typically requested
• Dispute/chargeback form (digital or PDF)
• Account statement showing the transaction(s) in question
• Supporting evidence (receipts, invoices, e-mails or chat transcripts with the merchant, screenshots, etc.)
• Government-issued photo ID if the customer has not previously verified identity through our digital channel

4. Escalation avenues
• Internal: A customer may request a secondary review by our Dispute Resolution Committee, chaired by a senior vice president not involved in the original decision.
• External: If still dissatisfied, they may contact the Financial Services Ombudsman or (for card disputes) the relevant card-scheme arbitration panel. Full contact details are provided in every resolution letter.

5. Recent enhancements
• Secure upload portal & electronic signature acceptance now cover more than 95 % of submissions.
• Mobile self-service tracking tool launched this year, giving customers real-time status updates and the ability to add evidence from their phone.
• Average resolution time in the past twelve months: 22 days, with 94 % of cases closed inside the 30-day target.

6. Illustrative case study
A recent high-value card dispute involving a well-known electronics retailer (“Glamour Gadgets”) followed the steps above: provisional credit issued within two weeks, investigation concluded inside 30 days, and permanent credit posted once liability was accepted. The customer received automated notifications at every milestone via the secure portal and e-mail.

I hope this provides the clarity you need for your article. If you would like additional anonymised data, a copy of our public policy document, or an interview to discuss the process in more depth, please let me know and I’d be happy to arrange it.

Best regards,

Jane Doe
Senior Manager, Customer Advocacy
Union Trust Bank
jane.doe@uniontrustbank.com
+1 (555) 987-6543"}
